front.title: Considerations for Captive Portals in HTTP

abstract.t: "Captive portals" are a commonly-deployed means of obtaining access credentials and/or payment for a network. This memo discusses issues of their use for HTTP applications, and proposes one possible mitigation strategy. This memo should be discussed on the ietf-http-wg@w3.org mailing list, although it is not a work item of the HTTPbis WG.
